annotations.text: CLC Industries is entitled to a 5-year grace period for the payment of land rent; After such period, CLC Industries must pay the annual lease rate of birr 665.85 per hectare, making an annual amount of birr 16,646,250, and total payment amount for the contract of birr 832,312,500; CLC Industries is also required to make a 1-year down payment, which stands adjusted for the lease fee payable for the sixth year, and payable through 3 equal installments during 2010-2011, to The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development reserves the right to revise the land rent once every 10 years; Any such rent increase shall not exceed 10% of the existing rental rate; Once the annual rent becomes payable after the grace period, CLC Industries must settle the annual rent during the months December up to June every year

The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development undertakes to provide, or cause to be provided, special investment privileges such as exemptions from importation duties of capital goods and repatriation of capital and profits granted under the investment laws of Ethiopia

CLC Industries has the right to develop or administer the land on its own or through a legally delegated person or agency; Unless 75% of the project land is developed, CLC Industries has no right to transfer the land or properties developed on the land to any other company or individual; Upon developing 75% of the project land, CLC Industries can transfer the land or properties developed on the land to another company or individual, only with the prior permit of The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development
annotations.category: Restrictions on transactions with affiliated parties

annotations.text: CLC Industries is entitled to a 5-year grace period for the land rent; After such period, CLC Industries must pay the annual lease rate of birr 665.85 per hectare, making an annual amount of birr 832,312,500, and total payment amount for the contract of birr 16,646,250; CLC Industries is also required to make a 1-year down payment, divided into 3 equal installments, to The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development reserves the right to revise the lease payment once after every 10 years as the need arises in consultation with CLC; Any increment in the lease rate shall not exceed 10% of the existing rate
CLC Industries is required to conduct an environmental impact assessment and deliver the report from that assessment within three months of execution of the contract

CLC Industries must provide good care and protection of the land and the natural resources thereon, and to; (i) conserve tree plantations that have not been cleared for earth works; (ii) apply appropriate work methods to prevent soil erosion in sloping areas; (iii) observe relevant natural resource conservation laws; and (iv) complete an environmental impact assessment and deliver the report from that assessment within three months of execution the contract
annotations.category: Protection of environment, harvesting practices (for forestry contracts), prevention of pollution, etc
Right to take and/or use water within/near contract concession area (including fees, licenses, and permits required)

annotations.text: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development must arrange for access and use of facilities of the Ethiopian government and the Regional State Research centers with fee for soil testing and mapping
annotations.category: Other - Access to Ethiopian government facilities

annotations.text: Upon entering into this contract, CLC Industries shall submit an advance action plan with regards to the use of the leased land to The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development
annotations.category: Feasibility studies and requirement of business plan

annotations.text: CLC Industries must start to develop the land within 6 months from the date of execution of the contract, or from the date that CLC Industries receives final clearance from the Ethiopian government, whichever is later; CLC Industries must execute all development activities as per the agreed business plan; CLC Industries must develop one tenth of the land within the first year; CLC Industries shall develop the entire leased land within 7 years from the date of signing or receipt of all necessary clearances from Ethiopian government

CLC Industries has the right to build infrastructure such as dams, water boreholes, power houses, irrigation systems, roads, bridges, offices, residential buildings, fuel/ power supply stations/outlets, health/ hospitals/ dispensaries and education facilities upon consultation and submission of permit request with concerned offices

annotations.category: Marketing of output and state access to output

annotations.text: Upon the expiry of the contract, CLC Industries shall remove assets installed on the leased land within 1 year; The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development has a priority right to purchase properties over the land in negotiation with CLC

The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development may monitor and establish that CLC Industries is discharging and accomplishing its obligations diligently, provided that this right is exercised and performed in a manner which does not cause any hindrances to the work and activities of CLC

The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development reserves the right to restore such lands covered by this contract which are not developed by CLC Industries within 1 year from the date specified for commencement of development, provided that CLC Industries is given 6 months' prior notice and fails to cure such failure within that 1 year period; The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall issue 6 months' advance notice prior to termination of the contract on the grounds of failure to develop the land within these time limits,  damage to the natural resources or failure to pay rent or relevant taxes; If such failure persists, The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development may extend the time period for such compliance
CLC Industries has the right to obtain additional land based on its performance, accomplishments and needs
annotations.category: Contracting party's permitted use of public or private land outside concession area

annotations.text: CLC Industries shall not make any unauthorized use of the land beyond the purpose or objectives of producing bio fuel, edible oil and value added crops, or the business plan as permitted under this contract without the written consent of The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development
annotations.category: Unauthorized use of the concession area

annotations.text: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall deliver the site plan and clear title certificate to CLC Industries within 30 days of signing the contract and the transfer shall come into force immediately thereafter; If the delivery process cannot be effected because of any reason caused by CLC, despite The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development informing CLC Industries in writing, The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall not assume any responsibility of such failure
annotations.category: Other - Delivery of the Leased Land

annotations.text: The laws of Ethiopia
annotations.category: Governing law in case of dispute

annotations.text: In the event of dispute, both parties will do their utmost to resolve the dispute amicably and to their mutual satisfaction through negotiation; If they are unable to achieve such a resolution, the dispute can be submitted to a competent Ethiopian court or if parties do not agree on the dispute resolution mechanism, the dispute can be referred to the International Center for Settlement of Investment Disputes under the rule governing additional facilities for administration of proceeding by the Secretariat of the Center; Such proceedings shall be in the English language

Unless 75% of the land is developed, CLC Industries has no right to transfer the land or any use right of the land or properties thereon to other persons; Upon developing 75% of the land, CLC Industries can transfer the land or the properties to any company or person only with the prior permit of The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development

CLC Industries has the right to terminate the contract subject to at least 6 months prior written notice upon justified good cause, including: (i) expiry of contract period; (ii) failure of The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development to deliver the land within 30 days of the down payment for other reasons than force majeure; (iii) breach of obligations or covenants by one party and failure to remedy after the other party gives 6 months' written notice; (iv) failure of CLC Industries to settle annual rental and other relevant taxes for 2 consecutive years; or (v) upon the giving of at least 6 months' written notice by one party to terminate the contract for its own good reasons

If the contract is terminated: (i) by CLC Industries for breach of obligations or covenants by The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; or (ii) by The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development for its own good reasons, The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall pay to CLC Industries the value of improvements made by CLC Industries on the land at the market price after deducting any rental or tax amounts owing
The contract is executed in the English language; All communications and notice required to be sent between parties shall be in writing in the English or Amharic language

CLC Industries shall provide correct data and investment activities reports upon request by The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development has the right to monitor and establish whether CLC Industries is fulfilling its obligations diligently; This monitoring must be done in a manner that does not cause any hindrances to the work and activities of CLC
annotations.category: Reporting Requirements and other methods of monitoring compliance

annotations.text: Conditions of force majeure shall be governed by the Ethiopian Civil Code

The contract is not subject to registration or approval by a notary office; The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development, as representative and highest authority of Ethiopian government party to the contract, shall guarantee validity of the contract; Copies of  the contract shall be sent to CLC, District administration,  finance office, investment commission and other concerned bodies
The Ethiopian calendar shall be used and shall be controlling for the purposes of this contract
Art. 5.4 is not included

The contract lists five documents as annexes, which are not included: (i) decision letter and minute for the contract; (ii) the land development schedule; (iii) the site plan of the leased land; (iv) photocopy of the ID or passport of a person duly authorized by CLC; and (v) photocopy of the memorandum and articles of association of CLC
